AMENDMENTS TO THE FOREIGN AGENTS REGISTRATION ACT OF 1938. The Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938 is amended to require quarterly reports to be filed on specific dates and to allow exemptions for legal representation upon request to the Attorney General. The Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938 is amended to include civil penalties for failure to file registration statements, omitting material facts, or making false statements. Penalties range from $2,000 to $5,000 per violation, with consideration given to the nature and duration of the violation.
